intro: Symplocos leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sand cherry, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, elliptical leaves that are typically less than 2 inches in length. It produces clusters of white to pale pink flowers in the spring, followed by small, red berries in the fall. The shrub is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
